headline: New Android Wear From Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Launches On February 9
article_text:
Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is ready to launch its two Android Wear 2.0 Smartwatches according to the famous American blogger and phone leaker, Evan Blass. The new products, Watch Sport and Watch Style will be introduced on Feb 9 alongside other anticipated updates. Rumor has it that the Smartwatches will be powered by the latest version of Android Wear, which is also slated to become available next month. Further claims indicate that Google has been working with LG, efforts that have resulted in the launch of the first ever Smartwatches.

Apparently, there has been mixed excitement about Smartwatches and a majority are of the opinion that the 2.0 might just be the savior. Notable features of the LG Smartwatches according to VentureBeat include Google Assistant integration.

More in terms of features

Each of the models has unique features the likes of a circular 1.2-inch 360×360 pixel display, 512MB of RAM and 240mAh battery for the Watch Style and 1.38-inch 480×480 screen, 768MB of RAM and a 430mAh battery for the Watch Sport.

In addition, they will both sport built-in Bluetooth and Wi-Fi, features that will facilitate navigation in a similar way to Apple’s iWatch. They will be able to accommodate 4GB of storage.

Launch of Wear 2.0 delayed by redesigning of OS

The Android Wear market has been stagnant for a couple of months now. A majority of vendors have been shying away from new products due to the dominance of the older smart watches as well as a lukewarm market. However, the launch of 2.0 would not have come any earlier because on response to the developer’s comments, the need to redesign its OS arose.

Nonetheless, a caption on the Wear 2.0 web page states, “Get ready for the next version of Android Wear! Support stand-alone Wear devices and apps. Create enhanced user interaction and glanceable experiences. Test your apps on Wear devices.”

Meanwhile, Alphabets stock closed at $829.02 witnessing an increase $1.56 or 0.19%.

headline: Microsoft, Intel, Alphabet Results Buoyed by Cloud Boom
article_text:
Alphabet Inc., Microsoft Corp. and Intel Corp., which all posted quarterly results Thursday, reinforced what’s become a truism in technology: the biggest growth is in businesses that deliver computing over the internet.

Microsoft topped projections on the strength of rising customer sign-ups for its cloud offerings like Azure, which saw revenue almost double. Intel sales rose more than expected, helped by orders for processors that power data-center servers -- the machines at the heart of cloud computing.

While profit at Google parent Alphabet disappointed, the numbers also signaled that heavy spending to catch cloud leaders Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft is paying off. Google’s Other Revenue line, which includes cloud computing, jumped 62 percent to $3.4 billion in the fourth quarter.

"Our cloud business is on a terrific upswing," Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said Thursday during a conference call with analysts. "I definitely think we’re going to have a great year."

What started a decade ago as an easy way for startups to run websites has turned into an increasingly popular way for companies of all sizes to access the software needed to run their operations. Many big technology companies are in a strong position to provide this because they already have huge data centers to support their own web services.

‘Disruptive Forces’

More than $1 trillion in IT spending will be directly or indirectly affected by the shift to cloud during the next five years, Gartner estimated in July. "This will make cloud computing one of the most disruptive forces of IT spending since the early days of the digital age," the research firm said at the time.

Stock prices reflect this optimism. Microsoft and Alphabet shares hit a record this week. Microsoft gained 2.2 percent, Google was down about 1 percent and Intel rose 1.5 percent at 1:57 p.m. Friday in New York.

Microsoft Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella has been working to reposition the company around such internet services. In addition to robust demand for Azure, consumers and corporations continue to purchase Office 365, a cloud-based version of the company’s productivity software that includes Word and Excel. Almost 25 million consumers are now subscribed to Office 365, Microsoft said, and sales increased 47 percent in the fiscal second quarter.

"As long as cloud is growing, people are happy,” said Mark Moerdler, an analyst at Sanford C. Bernstein & Co., who rates Microsoft shares outperform. “If margins are growing, people are even happier."

Microsoft’s Effort

Exclusive insights on technology around the world. Get Fully Charged, from Bloomberg Technology.

Redmond, Washington-based Microsoft has been spending on data centers and adding products to win new cloud customers. Chief Financial Officer Amy Hood said in July that gross margins, a measure of profitability, for the commercial cloud business would "materially improve" in the current year. That’s because previous years of investment are starting to pay off as those data centers support more customers.

Microsoft has pledged to reach annualized revenue of $20 billion in its corporate cloud business by the fiscal year that ends in June 2018. That metric stood at more than $14 billion at the end of the second quarter.

Intel’s fourth-quarter sales of server chips to cloud service providers jumped 30 percent from a year earlier. Offsetting that, companies and government agencies spent 7 percent less than they had in the same quarter in 2016 on equipping their in-house computer rooms, the company said.

“It’s moving to the public cloud, it’s moving to those areas at a faster rate than I think we expected,” Intel Chief Executive Officer Brian Krzanich said on a conference call.

Amazon reports earnings next week and analysts at RBC Capital Markets expect the company’s AWS cloud business to generate $3.6 billion in fourth-quarter revenue, up 50 percent from a year earlier.

"Microsoft is the plumbing in the cloud," Moerdler said. "Amazon is much bigger, but still Amazon and Microsoft are pulling away from the pack.”

headline: Will Alphabet Inc's (GOOG) Earnings Grow In Next 12 Months?
article_text:
Based on the latest analyst predictions Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG) is estimated to grow its earnings 18% over the next year. What should potential investors be aware of? I’m going to investigate the latest data and look into some metrics you shouldn’t overlook. View our latest analysis for Alphabet

Can we expect GOOG to keep growing?

Investors in Alphabet have been patiently waiting for the uptick in earnings and if you believe the 37 analysts covering the stock then the next 3 years will be very interesting. We are expecting to see the earnings grow around 62.9% and earnings per share estimates range from $37.57 to $63.51.







In the same period we will see the revenue increase from $90.27 Billion to $153.93 Billion in 2020 and net income is predicted to grow from $19,478 M to $45,802 M in 2020, roughly growing 2.4x. Margins are predicted to be extremely healthy during this time as well.

Is the growth built on solid basis?

Alphabet has underperformed the average growth in earnings of the Software industry over the past year.

Whilst GOOG’s Return on Equity of 15% isn’t horrific, it means that the company has underperformed the Software industry average of 22.72%. This is expected to slightly improve with analysts expecting ROE in 3 years to be 17.9%.





Return on equity (ROE) is a measure of how much profit (net income) a company makes as a percentage of the shareholders equity. Equity is made up of funds from the original issuing of shares and any retained earnings from previous financial years. It varies considerably across sectors, for this reason it is important to asses a stocks ROE relative to its industry. Whilst it is true that the higher the ROE the better the company is performing, ROE does have a weakness. A stock with a disproportionate amount of debt can lead to a small equity base. Thus, a small amount of net income (the numerator) could still produce a high ROE off a modest equity base (the denominator). For this reason investors should always consider the debt situation in conjunction with ROE.

Conclusion

Alphabet is a fast growing company, but as Warren Buffett’s right-hand man Charlie Munger said, “No matter how wonderful a business is, it’s not worth an infinite price“. Is GOOG overpriced? Or could it be considered an undervalued opportunity? I recommend you see our latest FREE analysis to find out!

If you are not interested in GOOG anymore, you can use our free platform to see my list of over 150 other stocks with a high growth potential.

headline: Google AR Shopping Tech: Alphabet Inc. Partners With BMW, Gap
article_text:
Google is working to create new shopping experiences for consumers. The company announced retail partnerships with BMW and Gap Inc. to use its augmented reality (AR) platform Project Tango and work towards creating a shopping experience in which shoppers do not need to be physically present at the retail outlet, but they can choose products as if they were.

“We see a lot of use of this technology in retail, for measuring your garage or buying big-ticket items like kitchens for example,” Eric Johnsen, business development executive, augmented reality at Google, spoke at CES in Las Vegas on Wednesday, where the deals were announced.

Tango uses computer vision comprising of technologies such as 3D mapping, motion-tracking and AR instead of GPS to help devices sense their environments.

Google’s technology venture will use cameras and sensors in smartphone to create digital images in physical spaces, the best example of which is the AR game Pokémon Go.

While Google’s deal with Gap Inc. will help consumer shop in Gap stores just like they would usually do — checking out and trying out merchandize, its deal with BMW is a little different.

With BMW, Google is trying out an AR app which will display its i3 and i8 cars on smartphone screens.

Car buyers will be able to check out superimposed vehicles and will not just be able to choose from different colors, trims and wheels but will also be able to place a high-resolution image of the vehicle inside their garage or driveway. BMW says that the app will be available at dealerships globally.

headline: F/X a headwind for Alphabet Inc., Facebook Inc, Amazon.com Inc. and Paypal ...
article_text:
With the USD appreciating versus major currencies since the U.S. presidential elections, Cantor Fitzgerald believes F/X will negatively impact 4Q results relative to expectations set in Oct./early-Nov. These F/X headwinds will be particularly apparent in results for companies with material international exposure, namely Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL), Facebook Inc. (NASADQ:FB), Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Paypal Holdings Inc (NASDSQ:PYPL).

Assuming the strong USD trade prevails, Cantor would expect 2017 outlook and estimates (from companies that guide) to be relatively cautious on international growth (all else equal/ex. hedging), even as strong consumer sentiment domestically drives healthy demand.

Amazon (int'l revs ~32%): A 2.4% gain in the USD vs. a basket of currencies from what Cantor believes is assumed in managements 4Q16 guidance should result in revenue headwind of ~$334M and ~$0.02 negative impact on EPS (FactSet consensus is $44.68B/$1.39 for rev./EPS vs. Cantor’s $44.26B/$1.26 estimates). On a Y/Y basis, F/X should result in a 90bps hit to top line growth vs. management’s assumption for a 60bps tailwind. For 2017, Cantor’s forecast (using prevailing rates) yields a headwind of $2.08B to revenues and ($0.14) impact on EPS (2017 consensus is $168.2B/ $8.74).

Facebook (int'l revs ~54%): For 4Q, a 250bp decline in a basket of currencies vs. the USD should result in revenue headwind of $116M and a ($0.02) impact on EPS (FactSet consensus is $8.70B/$1.13 for rev./EPS). For 2017, Cantor expects F/X to result in a 270bp hit to top line growth, resulting in a headwind of $732M/($0.14) to revenues/EPS (consensus at $36.71B/$5.21).

Google (int'l revs. ~54%): For 4Q, a 200bp increase in a basket of currencies vs. the USD should result in revenue headwind of $102M, and ($0.06) impact on EPS (FactSet consensus is $20.54B/$9.64 for rev./EPS). For 2017, Cantor expects a 130bp hit to top line growth, resulting in a headwind of $931M/($0.58) to revenues/EPS (consensus at $85.30B/$41.23). That said, Cantor thinks GOOGL's hedging program could offset much of this impact.

PayPal (int'l revs ~50%): For 4Q16, Cantor expects F/X to result in a ~$15M headwind to revenue and no meaningful impact on EPS vs. its estimates for $2,981M/$0.42 (FactSet consensus is at $2,977M/$0.42). For 2017, Cantor expects an incremental headwind of $223M on revenue and ($0.02) impact on EPS from F/X vs. consensus at $12.63B/$1.73.

headline: Alphabet Inc.: Google Finally Releases Its First Android 7.1.2 Public Beta For ...
article_text:
The search engine giant, Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google, came under the spotlight again as it released the first beta build of Android 7.1.2 on Monday. The new version of Android is currently available for Pixel, Pixel C, Pixel XL, Nexus 5X and Nexus Player and reports indicate that the update will soon be available for Nexus 6P.

The search engine giant claims to have many new innovative features and improved performance in its recent Android update. Many analysts believe that this move seems to be a part of Google’s bigger plan to create traction among the users to buy its Pixel devices. Also, the tech giant mentioned in its blog post that the new version of Android is “an incremental maintenance release focused on refinements."

Moreover, as the competition in the smartphone industry continues to surge at a fast pace, it seems that Google is making efforts to muster significant amount of market share by offering new and improved features to its users. Also, Google confirmed that its Android 7.1.2 is set for a public release in the coming few months, and the company mainly focused on fixing bugs to boost the performance. However, those using Pixel can update their device to the newly released beta program.

It is worth mentioning that Google’s main rival, Apple, experienced a drop in the sales of iPhone for the first time during the last fiscal year. Hence, many analysts believe that this is the right time for Google to release its new update for Android as it will help in enticing users to switch to its platform. In any case, it is yet to be seen whether the Android update will help the tech titan in enticing users to buy its Pixel devices.

headline: Alphabet Inc.: HTC Vive Design Team Head Joins Google to Work on Daydream
article_text:
Over the past year, VR has grown immensely as an industry. 360-degree videos and virtual reality content have also taken off, and VR is now available on desktop PCs, smartphones and even consoles with the PSVR. A new contender, the HTC Vive, helped popularize the market while Samsung with the Gear VR made the technology accessible to millions of users. Today, one of the key members of the HTC Vive team, design team head Claude Zellweger left the company and joined Google to work on its VR solution, the Google Daydream.

The ex-HTC employee announced via a tweet that he was moving over to Google's Daydream team. Claude was a veteran at HTC with eight years under his belt. He worked on the design of various HTC handset including the HTC U devices, but mainly on the Vive. In a statement obtained by The Verge, HTC confirmed that the employee was departing.

"HTC can confirm that Claude Zellweger has left the Company. We appreciate his considerable contribution to HTC, and wish him well in his future endeavors. HTC continues to invest in talent and recruitment as part of our broader strategy to ensure the continued strength and integrity of the Company’s organizational structure."

Zellweger has not revealed what exactly he will be working on for Daydream, but judging by his experience, it's possible that he will be working on creating new VR headsets for the Android platform. Only time will tell what strides Google will make in the VR space now that the competition is heating up.

headline: Fake News Publishers Banned From Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google Ad Network
article_text:
A total of 200 publishers were removed from Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOGL) ad networks following an increase in so-called fake news. The publishers were banned in the fourth quarter of 2016 in line with an update to an existing policy that sought to deter websites from offering misleading content. Who determines what content is misleading and how is the ultimate question.

On Google’s ad network it is common for advertisers to be ejected if they are found to have provided misleading or false claims. Following the proliferation of so-called fake news in 2016, offending sites were added to the blacklist.

Popular vote controversy

Google is on record for having been on the receiving end after it featured a news item from a supposed false news site. The news item alleged that Donald Trump had beaten Hillary Clinton in the popular vote count when in fact she had garnered close to three million votes more than him. Not all the publishers who were banned were purveyors of this kind of news, though.

As per the ‘bad ads’ report which Google releases at the start of every year, some of the publishers who were banned in the months of December and November last year included websites that impersonated established news media organizations. Some of the impersonators took advantage of truncated top-level domains such as ‘.co’ instead of ‘.com’. Google did not, however, list the offending sites.

Google’s annual ‘bad ads’ report also revealed statistics on the number of ads that had been nixed. A total of 1.7 billion ads were taken down by Google for various violations. This was more than double the 780 million ads that had been removed in 2015.

Better detectors

The Mountain View, California-based tech titan has attributed the jump in ads removed to the technological improvements with regards to tools used to identify offending advertisements and advertiser behavior. In mid-2016 Google had enacted a policy that prohibited payday loan ads as it claimed they were predatory. This resulted in about five million ads of such nature disabled in the second half of 2016.

“In the past year, what’s really changed is that we’ve expanded our policies so we can better protect consumers against issues like misleading ads and predatory offers,” Google’s director of product management, Scott Spencer, told Wired.

In Wednesday’s trading, Alphabet Inc rose by 1.05% to close the day at $858.45.

Finally, HighPoint Advisor Group LLC boosted its stake in shares of Alphabet by 3.0% in the third quarter. HighPoint Advisor Group LLC now owns 1,767 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,363,000 after buying an additional 51 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 34.19% of the company’s stock.

Alphabet Company Profile

Alphabet Inc is a holding company. The Company holds interests in Google Inc (Google). The Company’s segments include Google and Other Bets. Google segment includes Internet products, such as Search, Ads, Commerce, Maps, YouTube, Apps, Cloud, Android, Chrome, Google Play, and hardware products, including Chromecast, Chromebooks and Nexus, which are sold by the Company.

headline: Alphabet Inc YouTube Launches Super Chat
article_text:
Published By: Patrick Arruda on January 13, 2017 10:18 am EST

Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) YouTube has launched a new feature called "Super Chat" which has given creators another way to make money and even fans to interact with YouTubers easily. The feature’s timing is perfect as the company announced its plan to stop monetization of videos known as “Fan Funding.” Thus, now creators have been given another way to earn money from their content.

Super Chat will allow viewers to pin a comment on live broadcasts; a dollar bill symbol will also be seen in the chat window. Users will be able to choose through a slider to select how many dollars would they like to send to the particular YouTuber they enjoy.

The more the user will pay, the more comments will get pinned. Once the payment is made, the comment will be highlighted in another color so that live streamers can flag the paid comment. In case that particular comment is pushed off the stream, creators will still be able to click through paid comments thanks to the colorful pins which will appear at the top of the window screen.

Super Chat is simply a replacement for Fan Funding which will keep creators interested in the platform. The product manager of the company, Barbara Macdonald, said that this is one way fans will be able to reach their favorite creators on the platform and vice versa. Fan Funding was launched back in 2014, through which viewers were able to make payments by choice to creators they enjoyed. Now FF will accept sign ups but will keep on working for channels that have it till the February 28, which is when it will be discontinued.

The new tool will be available in 20 countries to creators, while viewers in 40 countries will be allowed to buy Super Chat messages. Fan Funding is being discontinued because it was not used on a large scale in the first place. Hopefully Super Chat might not give the same result. The tool is for users above 18 years, who own credit cards, but kids might be able to use it if they use their parents’ credit cards. YouTube can be given feedback for two and a half weeks of the launch of Super Chat.

headline: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL): LG G6 to Be First Non-Pixel Phone with Google Assistant
article_text:
The rumors regarding LG's upcoming flagship have been circulating, and it looks like it isn't focusing much on secrecy with this new device. First, we got a look at how the device would look like, thanks to some leaks. Now, more of details have surfaced about the feature set it will offer. Today, CNET reported that the LG G6 would come with Google Assistant built-in.

This notion would make the G6 the first phone, apart from the Pixel phones to offer the digital assistant. Users will get access to the chatbot, along with the complete voice command functionality. It seems that this year the focus on personal assistants will be great. These assistants are now considered a big selling point for the devices. Even Samsung is rumored to enter this competition with Bixby - its virtual assistant. The company recently acquired the AI startup Viv Labs to ensure a stellar product.

According to CNET, LG was first opting to use Amazon Alexa with the LG G6; however, it decided against it since it felt that the assistant wasn't up to the task. Along with these new features, we already know a few details about the upcoming device. It is reported that the phone would feature a 5.7-inch display with an 18:9 aspect ratio, sports premium metal construction and will be waterproof. The modularity - a hit-and-miss on the G5 - has been dropped in this model. We'll know all the details about the handset when it launches on February 26.

headline: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL): Google Confirms That Hardware Is To Blame For Audio ...
article_text:
Over the past few weeks, a certain audio distortion issue plaguing many Pixel phones has been gaining a lot of traction. The issue was originally brought into the limelight by Mark Buckman, who managed to get a refund on his Pixel device after posting about the issue on Google's Product Forums.

While that was a one-off event, Google has now officially acknowledged the existence of the issue and is offering replacement handsets for people with affected devices. Since Google is offering replacements rather than rolling out a software update to fix the issue, it’s clear that the problem is hardware related.

PhoneArena also revealed that Google has stopped issuing refunds on the units like the one given to Mark Buckman. Instead, the company is asking users to opt for warranty replacements. Google has been very proactive regarding the audio distortion issues on its product forums. There have been numerous posts on the forum and the Google Pixel community manager Orrin even notified that the tech giant has been looking into the matter.

One aspect of this matter is irking a lot of users; Google isn't notifying users of the builds which have been affected by this issue. If Google would do this, users would be able to check if their current phone is faulty and would be able to check before purchasing a faulty build.

Even though the Google Pixel has managed to garner amazing reviews from across the board, the phone has come under fire a few times since its launch. Just last month, numerous users reported premature shutdowns on the device, while complaints about lens flare were also rampant in the same month.
